commit.message:
Update branding doc

A few minor changes:

- Removed statement that the logo was designed by Immo (sorry Immo!).
- Added pixel dimensions of images.
- Moved images out of headings, as they looked like they belonged to the previous section.

Increase MSBuild-NuGet-Icon.png to 128x128px

This is the recommended size for NuGet package icons.
Add vector versions of MSBuild logo

nodes.body:
On the NuGet icon, the docs suggest an image size of 128x128px. From https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/reference/nuspec#icon:

> Image file size is limited to 1 MB. Supported file formats include JPEG and PNG. We recommend an image resolution of 128x128.

Also, is there an SVG version of the logo that can be added here?

> On the NuGet icon, the docs suggest an image size of 128x128px. From https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/reference/nuspec#icon:
> 
> > Image file size is limited to 1 MB. Supported file formats include JPEG and PNG. We recommend an image resolution of 128x128.
> 
> Also, is there an SVG version of the logo that can be added here?

Hi Drew,

We don't have 128x128, only 64x64 or 256x256
and no svg format in the initial set. Is it necessary to request these pics?

> Is it necessary to request these pics?

I would definitely ask the design team for a vector-based version of the logo, and add it here. SVG is great, but AI/PDF are fine too.

A vector-based version of the logo can be used in more places. For example, to print stickers/posters with the logo, you'd want much higher resolution, and vectors can scale to any size. It'd allow us to produce the 128x128px version ourselves.

Hi @drewnoakes ,

I have requested these images from designers team. I will get back to you once they are ready.
@drewnoakes , please let me know where I should put them: https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:u:/t/ManagedLanguagesIDE/Ef6JtTNMXYZEoVkGEH9BQVgBTZAveYZh2mCSx6Mt2i0edA?e=yrCUFb

Thanks @YuliiaKovalova. I've included the SVG file and changed the NuGet icon to the 128x128px version.

Also optimized the PNG files a little:
